function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Compliance with lockdown measures influenced by fear of disease, moral support, and social norms.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lower self-control leading to non-compliance with lockdown measures.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concordance between self-reported and objective compliance measures","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sampling bias in the study","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unobserved differences affecting study outcomes","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Response biases in self-reported compliance data","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trust in government and leaders influencing compliance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Opportunity to violate measures leading to noncompliance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impulsivity associated with noncompliance","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Positive association between social norms and compliance","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No strict enforcement of covid-19 mitigation measures in the netherlands.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to comply with measures due to lack of resources or knowledge.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clarity about the covid-19 measures.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No relation between costs of compliance and compliant behavior","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No relation between negative emotions and compliance","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relatively high self-reported compliance with coronavirus mitigation measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to analyze changes in behavior due to single moment measurement","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Prediction that greater costs of compliance would predict less compliance","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Publication of non-peer-reviewed research","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Gender and trust in science correlate with compliance","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived threat, moral alignment, and impulsivity correlate with compliance","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Descriptive social norms correlate with compliance","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data analysis on compliance measures","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Positive correlation between compliance and perceived threat, specific moral alignment, negative emotions, and other factors.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative correlation between compliance and opportunity to violate, impulsivity, and non-normative ool.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived fairness of law enforcement in creating and enforcing covid-19 mitigation measures","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-compliance with covid-19 measures due to impulsivity","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low descriptive social norms for compliance with covid-19 measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants may have low practical capacity to comply with covid-19 mitigation measures, as indicated by the measures of their ability to comply with the measures and the opportunity to violate them.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants may perceive the covid-19 measures as unclear, leading to confusion and potential non-compliance.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measurement of negative emotions related to covid-19 on a 7-point likert scale could lead to underreporting or misinterpretation of emotional impact.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived certainty of punishment for violating covid-19 measures may influence compliance behavior and risk perception.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measurement of capacity to comply with covid-19 measures involves subjective assessments that may not accurately reflect actual behavior and adherence.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low support for covid-19 mitigation measures","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor compliance due to perceived negative impact","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants with underlying health issues at risk for contracting covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low compliance with covid-19 mitigation measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived threat of coronavirus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants providing professional care for covid-19 patients","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Visiting friends or family over the age of 75 on a regular basis","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Survey participation excluding individuals who failed the attention check","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for non-compliance with pandemic measures due to perceptions of procedural fairness and justice","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of political orientation on compliance with covid-19 measures","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perception of limited choice leading to compliance out of coercion and fear","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear rules leading to non-compliant behavior","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of descriptive social norm on compliance","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Obligation to obey the law and procedural justice lack of capacity to comply","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"}]}
